alert.note: Alert for Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:02PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Scott County through 330 PM CDT... At 302 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Homewood, or 7 miles south of Forest. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Scott County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
